references.paper_title: Cross-image attention for zero-shot appearance transfer
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel cross-image attention mechanism for zero-shot appearance transfer, which is a key technique used in Ctrl-X for spatially-aware appearance transfer.

references.paper_title: Freecontrol: Training-free spatial control of any text-to-image diffusion model with any condition
references.reason: This paper presents a training-free and guidance-free framework for controlling spatial aspects of text-to-image generation, which directly inspired the design and methodology of Ctrl-X.

references.paper_title: Diffusion self-guidance for controllable image generation
references.reason: This paper proposes a training-free method for controllable image generation using diffusion models, providing valuable insights and related work for Ctrl-X's guidance-free approach.
This paper provides a comprehensive overview and implementation of state-of-the-art diffusion models, which serves as the foundational model for Ctrl-X and enables easy reproducibility.

references.paper_title: Adding conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces ControlNet, a popular framework for controllable image generation using diffusion models, which provides a strong baseline for comparison with the proposed Ctrl-X method.
